text.title: Make Your Polyvore Set Popular
text.head: Make Your Polyvore Set Popular
text.p: Polyvore is a popular website that allows you to create collages ( or sets ) that fall into one of four categories : fashion , beauty , home , or art & expression . This guide tells you how to promote your set once it has been published , so that you can get lots of views , comments and favorites .
text.head: Steps

list.item: Put lots of effort into creating your set . The better it is , the easier it will be to promote .

Submit your set to the max of five groups . In choosing the groups :
Make sure they are relevant .
Try to choose a mixture of specialised groups , for example , punk , and general groups , everyone on Polyvore .
Choose semi-popular groups with a few hundred members ; it they 're too unpopular , no one will ever check the page . Equally though , if they 're too popular , your set will be knocked off the ' recent sets ' section too quickly .
Change the groups that your set is submitted to regularly . Change it perhaps every two-four weeks .
Optionally , you can create your own group and invite lots of people to join it .
Submit your set to as many different contests as possible .
Make sure you have a lot of contacts .
Comment regularly on other peoples sets ( contacts or not ) , this makes it is very likely they will comment back on yours and is the best way of attracting interest .

Add hash tags . When you make your set , put # ( hash tags ) on them so when people search for the relevant word , your set/collection/group will come up .
For example , if your set has a day dress in it put #daydress . Make such it relates to your set .
Add tag lists of people . Add someone like @shans10 , for example . Then that person will see your set , thank you for the tag and look on your wall . People may then tag you back !

Make your sets visually appealing and unique .
For example , do n't make an outfit with a bland t-shirt and skinny jeans . Polyvore is used to be creative , not show what you wear every day .
Let 's be honest , those sets with items far apart , photographs that are n't incorporated well , and overused ( and ugly ) fonts and background colors are eyesores . Use only photographs with muted colors in the background to make it visually appealing but not distracting , and try using newspaper articles and quotes to make it look cool . When you are n't putting anything in the background , try to organize your items so that they fit well together , like pieces of a puzzle .

text.head: Tips

list.item: Success on Polyvore is n't everything . Having fun is a better goal .
Give your best , Polyvore fans would love to see you try your all , have fun during the process !
Basically just add a lot of hashtags and you will get likes in just a couple of minutes or hours depending on how good and how much effort you have put to your items/outfits .
Follow other people and like their sets . In return , they 'll follow you and like your sets back !

text.head: Warnings

list.item: Do n't comment only on very popular sets . If they 're getting dozens every day , they probably wo n't bother looking at every one .
